law.catch_line: Except as provided in subsection (b) of this section, a local official may:...

text.section:
Except as provided in subsection (b) of this section, a local official may:
certify to the Comptroller the existence of a person's delinquent tax liability or any other liability owed by the person to the local official's political subdivision; and
request the Comptroller to withhold any refund and vendor payment to which the person is entitled.

A local official may not certify or request the Comptroller to withhold a refund or vendor payment unless the laws of the local official's political subdivision:
allow the Comptroller to certify tax due to the State;
allow the Comptroller to request the local official to withhold from any vendor payment the person's tax due to the State; and
provide for the payment of the amount withheld to the Comptroller.
The withholding of a refund or vendor payment shall be subject to the priorities under § 13-918 of this subtitle.
